com.link_intersystems.lang.reflect

Class AbstractInvokable

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.link_intersystems.lang.reflect.AbstractInvokable
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Invokable

    public abstract class AbstractInvokable
extends Object
implements Invokable
    Implements the adaption for Invokable.asCallable(Object...), Invokable.asRunnable(Object...), Invokable.invoke(Object...) and Invokable.invokeWithContextClassLoader(ClassLoader, Object...) and delegates to the subclass's doInvoke(Object...) method.
    Version:
    1.2.0;
    Author:
    Ren√© Link [rene.link@link- intersystems.com]

      • invoke

        public <T> T invoke(Object... args)
             throws Exception
        Invokes the Member2 that this Invokable has been created from on the target object that was passed to the factory method for this Invokable.
        Specified by:
        invoke in interface Invokable
        Parameters:
        args - the parameter object to use when invoking.
        Returns:
        Throws:
        Exception - if one of the declared exceptions (if any) of the invokable is thrown.
        See Also:
        Method2.getInvokable(Object), Constructor2.getInvokable()

        Parameters:

      • getAccessibleObject

        protected AccessibleObject getAccessibleObject()
        Subclasses should implement this method if they operate on AccessibleObjects.
        Returns:

      • isApplicable

        protected boolean isApplicable(Object... params)
        Subclasses should implement this method to decide if this Invokable is applicable for the arguments that is currently invoked with. This method is called by the template method invoke(Object...) and lets subclasses hook into the invocation process to support applicable invocations only. This default implementation always returns true.
        Parameters:
        params - the parameters that this Invokable's Invokable.invoke(Object...) method is invoked with.
        Returns:
        Since:
        1.2.0;

      • isDeclaredException

        protected boolean isDeclaredException(Exception e)
        Subclasses might override this method to decide if an occurred exception is declared for this Invokable.
        Parameters:
        e -
        Returns:
        Since:
        1.2.0;

      • doInvoke

        protected abstract <T> T doInvoke(Object... args)
                           throws Exception
        Called by the template method invoke(Object...) after:
        • the invoke(Object...)'s methods argument has been checked to be not null (an array or an empty arguments array has been passed to the invocation).
        • the arguments are applicable for this Invokable (checked by calling isApplicable(Object...) - subclasses should implement)
        Any thrown exception is handled by the template method invoke(Object...):
        • RuntimeExceptions are re-thrown.
        • checked exceptions are re-thrown if they are declared by this Invokable.
        • undeclared checked exceptions are wrapped into an InvocationTargetException and thrown.
        Parameters:
        args - the checked invocation arguments. See the method' javadoc for details.
        Returns:
        the invocation result of this Invokable.
        Throws:
        Exception - a declared or undeclared exception that occurred during invocation of this Invokable. See javadoc for exception handling details done by the template method invoke(Object...) that calls doInvoke(Object...).
        Since:
        1.2.0;

      • invokeWithContextClassLoader

        public <RESULT_TYPE> RESULT_TYPE invokeWithContextClassLoader(ClassLoader classLoader,
                                                              Object... params)
                                                       throws Exception
        Ensures that this Invokable is invoked with the given ClassLoader bound as the current Thread's context class loader. Ensures that any previous context class loader is re-bound to the current Thread's context when returning.
        Specified by:
        invokeWithContextClassLoader in interface Invokable
        Parameters:
        classLoader - the class loader that should be bound as the current thread's context class loader during invocation of this Invokable.
        params - the parameter to pass to this Invokable.
        Returns:
        the result of the invocation of this Invokable.
        Throws:
        Exception
        Since:
        1.2.0;

      • asRunnable

        public final Runnable asRunnable(Object... params)
        Returns a Runnable adapter for this Invokable. If you are interested in the return type use Invokable.asCallable(Object...);
        Specified by:
        asRunnable in interface Invokable
        Returns:
        a Runnable adapter for this Invokable. If you are interested in the return type use Invokable.asCallable(Object...);
        Since:
        1.2.0;
